movie_title: The Fermi Paradox — Where Are All The Aliens? (1/2)
introduction: The universe is unbelievably big – trillions of stars and even more planets. Soo… there just has to

vocabulary.definition: able to be seen or noticed
vocabulary.example: The observable universe is vast and full of mysteries.

vocabulary.definition: suitable or good enough to live in
vocabulary.example: Scientists search for habitable planets outside our solar system.

vocabulary.definition: a statement or situation that may be true but seems to be impossible or difficult to understand
vocabulary.example: The Fermi paradox questions the existence of extraterrestrial civilizations.

vocabulary.definition: an advanced stage of human social development and organization
vocabulary.example: A type 3 civilization would control its entire galaxy.

vocabulary.definition: succeed in dealing with a problem or difficulty
vocabulary.example: Humanity must overcome great challenges to reach the stars.
The tiny planet was covered in moist soil and lush vegetation.
